attributes.action: English referendum on leaving the UK. Thus automatically withdrawing us from EU.
attributes.additional_details:
Due to recent events in parliament, it is clear the union cannot go on the way it is. It was always going to be a choice between our union, and the European Union - remainers have made that clear. 

The English people should finally get a vote on independence from the UK. With a majority this would disband the Acts of Union (which would happen if any UK country voted for independence). This would automatically end our membership of the EU. 

To the PM:
Please consider this option and get us out.
attributes.background:
Scotland and Northern Ireland have had several referenda on being part of the UK. England is the only country not to have had such a vote.

If we have another referendum, it should be on our independence. If successful this would trigger the entire UK’s departure from the EU with immediate effect.

rejection.details:
We can't accept your petition because the UK Government and Parliament aren't responsible for the issue you raise. Decisions on continuing member states of the EU is a matter for the European Union.

In any case, we're not sure what you would like to happen to Wales in the scenario in your petition.
